title.narrative: POLICIES AND STANDARDS FOR NUTRITION SERVICES

description.narrative: Output 2.2 Government is able to produce multi-sectoral policies and standards to guide and monitor nutrition services to the most disadvantaged women and children.

sector.narrative: National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

related-activity.ref: 2450/A0/06/002 OUTCOME 2. ACCESS TO SURVIVAL, LEARNINGAND DEVELOPMENT SERVICES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2 Government is able to produce multi-sectoral policies and standards to guide and monitor nutrition services to the most disadvantaged women and children.

description.narrative: The approved Food Security and Nutrition Programme for 2019-2023 (FSNP), which was developed with the support of UNICEF and other partners as a comprehensive multi-sectoral policy, sets ambitious targets aiming at a 30 percent reduction in the number of children under-5, who are stunted and 40 percent reduction of anaemia in women of reproductive age and in children 6-59 months. In 2019, along with technical assistance to the Ministry of Health to update the set of guidelines to improve maternal and child nutritional status in the Kyrgyz Republic, UNICEF supported the development of a nutrition information management system. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/12/2019

title.narrative: Existence of a functional national multisectoral committee for nutrition

baseline.value: Committee on Nutrition exists, but not functional

target.value: 2022:Committee on Nutrition is functional and run by the Government

actual.value: 2019:Food Security and Nutrition Programme approved on 27, June, 2019 by Government Decree ¿320.

title.narrative: Existence of a national programme targeting anaemia reduction among women and girls

baseline.value: Current Food Security and Nutrition program expired in 2017

target.value: 2020:Evidence generation for improved and targeted reduction of anaemia through National Integrated Micronutrient and Anthropometric Survey (NIMA) launch (Phase 1)

actual.value: 2019:Food Security and Nutrition Programme 2019-2023 approved by the Government Decree ¿320 dd 27June, 2019. The Programme outlines policies and measures to improve nutritional status of population, including anaemia reduction, consistent with internationally agreed recommendations. Moreover, Action Plan

title.narrative: Existence of a national management information system that includes disaggregated data on nutrition, including sex-disaggregated data

actual.value: 2019:Based on the Global Nutrition Report, nutrition indicators revised. 11 indicators, which were not collected previously, are being introduced into the routine statistics.

title.narrative: 1- Integration of maternal and child nutrition counseling and BFHI into existing health system (Home visiting and BFHI)

target.value: 2019:Modules developed for in-service and pre-service training of Nutrition and BFHI.
